showScoreExcerpt:
"The genre is actually closer to a 'horror play' and the terror is slowly built by our post-911, post-Hurricane Sandy, survival-mode ethos...Reed Birney, as the patriarch, gives a nuanced, painful performance as he falls from grace...This play stuck with me for days after I saw it. Maybe itâ€™s because of the personal challenges in my life, but it shook me to the core and left me with a depression that was hard to exorcise. You have been warned."
